alert.note: Alert for Chaves; Curry; Harding; Quay; Roosevelt; San Miguel; Union (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 26 at 4:46PM MST until February 26 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Roosevelt County in east central New Mexico... Eastern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... Southeastern Harding County in northeastern New Mexico... Northeastern Chaves County in southeastern New Mexico... Quay County in east central New Mexico... Curry County in east central New Mexico... Southeastern Union County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 443 PM MST, blowing dust was indicated by satellite stretching along the eastern New Mexico/west Texas border from near Milnesand north through Nara Visa. The lowest visibilities in blowing dust will continue to shift eastward and exit Texas. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 336 and 373. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 361 and 397. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Nara Visa, Texico, Logan, Melrose, San Jon, Elida, Dora and Grady. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust can be unhealthy and has been known to lead to Valley Fever. Avoid outdoor exposure. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: Chaves; Curry; Harding; Quay; Roosevelt; San Miguel; Union
